I've wondered that myself, though with synaptic
can I make it a little easier for ya,
dpkg -l |awk '{print $2}'|tail -n+6| wc -l) packages installed" > Installed_Files.txt
I would hate to have like one package missing and not know what the hell it was lol
no its this dpkg -l |awk '{print $2}' > Installed_Packages.txt
that will make a list of every package installed on your pc
alternate way http://www.cyberciti.biz/tips/linux-get-list-installed-software-reinstallation-restore.html
